creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. George B. Millard
description: stirrup pot with a warrior sitting cross-legged on top; figures painted in red on cream
text: Often described as a ritual runner, or chasqui, the messenger is a recurrent theme in Moche ceramic artwork. Messengers are shown both as dressed humans and as part human and part animal. These individuals carried messages across Moche society and were a part of many ceremonial processions. Shown here are part-animal messengers carrying their bags with a surrounding lima bean motif.
title: Vessel
